items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: West Texas Recovery Props up Natural Gas Cash Market
items.summary: Spot gas prices tumbled in several regions on Wednesday as buyers breathed sighs of relief amid forecasts for benign weather ahead. But a sharp – though partial – recovery in Permian Basin prices bolstered the national average.

items.title: Federal Approval of Rio Grande Tanks Signals Progress Toward 2027 First LNG
items.summary: NextDecade Corp. has received authorization from federal regulators to build Storage Tanks 3 and 4 at its Rio Grande LNG facility in South Texas.

items.title: Futures Settle: After CME Halts Trading – Again – March Natural Gas Trends Higher into Expiry
items.summary: Front-month natural gas futures floated upward into expiration on Wednesday. Traders rolled over positions to ensuing contracts while weighing expectations for strong long-term export activity against fading near-term weather demand – but not without

items.title: Midday Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Mixed as Waha Jumps, Demand Slides
items.summary: Spot natural gas prices edged higher on average into midday Wednesday as a sharp rally in West Texas offset softer national demand forecasts.

items.title: Midday Futures: Natural Gas Climbs Ahead of March Contract Roll-Off
items.summary: Natural gas futures firmed into midday Wednesday as traders shrugged off expectations for a seasonally bearish storage report, eyeing rising LNG feed gas demand and April’s move to prompt month.

items.title: Diamondback CEO Says Investors ‘Deserve Better Return’ on Permian Natural Gas
items.summary: Diamondback Energy Inc. is on a mission to capture higher prices for its Permian Basin natural gas production as egress capacity expands out of the oil-rich region, according to CEO Kaes Van’t Hof.

items.title: Saudi Arabia Boosting Oil Output In Anticipation of U.S. Attacks On Iran

items.title: White House Presses Tech Giants to Shield Households From AI Power Costs

items.title: OPEC+ To Consider Oil Output Hike By 137,000 bpd For April
items.summary: OPEC+ is likely to consider increasing oil output by 137,000 barrels per day (bpd) for April 2026, ending a three-month pause in hikes as they prepare for peak summer demand and navigate market share strategies, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday ahead

items.title: EIA Confirms Wild Swing in Crude Oil Inventories

items.title: Black Sea Bottleneck Stalls Tengiz Oil Comeback
